wikitext.*:
[[File:J.R.R. Tolkien - Map of Wilderland.jpg|thumb]]
The '''Map of Wilderland''', depicting the region of [[Rhovanion]], is included in ''[[The Hobbit]]'' (and as plate No. 87 in ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: Artist and Illustrator|J.R.R. Tolkien: Artist & Illustrator]]'').<ref name=AH>{{HM|AH}}, p. 399</ref><ref name=AI>{{HM|AI}}, pp. 90-5</ref>

The map was drawn by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]], and a preliminary version of the map appears as plate No. 84 in ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: Artist and Illustrator|J.R.R. Tolkien: Artist & Illustrator]]''.<ref name=AI/> In [[1979]] a coloured version by [[H.E. Riddett]] was published as a poster by [[Allen and Unwin|Allen & Unwin]].<ref name=AH/> 

J.R.R. Tolkien added the river names "Mitheithel = [[Hoarwell]]", "[[Bruinen]]" with "Loudwater" below it to the river flowing north of [[Rivendell]], "Merrill" to the river flowing south of Rivendell, "Rushdown" with "[[Rhimdath]]" below it and "[[Gladden River|R. Gladden]]" and the area names "Entish land", "Hoardale" and "[[Gladden Fields]]" in pencil on the Map of Wilderland<ref>{{webcite|author=J.R.R. Tolkien|articleurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181220064018if_/http://www.tolkienestate.com/assets/images/megamaps/wilderland.jpg|articlename=Maps: WILDERLAND|dated=|website=|accessed=4 November 2024}}</ref> in one of his copies of ''The Hobbit''<ref>{{HM|RS}}, p. 205</ref>.
